intro: Parietaria decoris, commonly known as the pretty wallwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its small, green, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces tiny, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on slender peduncles. Parietaria decoris is typically found growing in moist, shady environments such as woodland areas or along stream banks. It is a perennial herb that can spread via rhizomes, forming dense mats in suitable habitats.
